name: Foundations: What Is LGBTQ+ Studies?
description: An introduction to the field — its origins, key concepts, terminology, and why it matters as an academic discipline.

name: Queer Theory: Key Thinkers and Concepts
description: The intellectual foundations of LGBTQ+ Studies — the theorists, frameworks, and ideas that shaped the field.

name: Hidden History: LGBTQ+ Lives Before Stonewall
description: Queer lives have always existed. This course recovers the history that was deliberately erased.

name: Stonewall and the Birth of Gay Liberation
description: The 1969 uprising and its aftermath — how a police raid became the catalyst for a global movement.

name: The AIDS Crisis: Abandonment, Activism, and Survival
description: How government inaction turned a health crisis into mass death — and how the community fought back.

name: The Fight for Legal Equality
description: From criminalization to civil rights — the legal battles that shaped LGBTQ+ life in America.

name: Transgender Lives, History, and Rights
description: A dedicated exploration of transgender experience — from historical gender diversity to current political targeting.

name: Intersex: Biology, Medicine, and Rights
description: Understanding intersex variations — the biology, the history of medical intervention, and the fight for bodily autonomy.

name: LGBTQ+ People of Color
description: The intersection of race and queerness — distinct histories, unique challenges, and the leaders who shaped both movements.

name: LGBTQ+ Families and Relationships
description: How queer people build families — adoption, surrogacy, chosen family, and relationship structures.

name: LGBTQ+ Aging: Elders, Care, and Legacy
description: The unique challenges facing LGBTQ+ older adults — isolation, discrimination in care, and building intergenerational community.

name: Religion, Spirituality, and Queerness
description: The complex relationship between LGBTQ+ identity and faith — from condemnation to affirmation.

name: LGBTQ+ Health and Mental Health
description: Health disparities, the legacy of pathologization, and what affirming healthcare looks like.

name: LGBTQ+ Youth: Schools, Bullying, and Resilience
description: What it's like to grow up LGBTQ+ in America — the challenges in schools, the role of GSAs, and building resilience.

name: Queer Culture: Literature, Art, and Expression
description: The extraordinary creative legacy of LGBTQ+ people — from underground art to mainstream influence.

name: LGBTQ+ Music and Performance
description: How queer artists shaped popular music and performance culture.

name: LGBTQ+ in Media and Popular Culture
description: Representation, stereotypes, and the power of visibility — how media shapes perception.

name: The Politics of Anti-LGBTQ+ Movements
description: Understanding the opposition — who funds it, what motivates it, and the strategies used to roll back rights.

name: LGBTQ+ Rights as a Global Issue
description: Queerness around the world — from full equality to death penalty.

name: LGBTQ+ Economics: Work, Wages, and Wealth
description: The economic realities of LGBTQ+ life — from workplace discrimination to wealth gaps.

name: Lesbian History and Feminism
description: The distinct history of lesbian identity, its relationship with feminism, and the contributions of lesbian women.

name: Bisexual, Pansexual, and Fluid Identities
description: The often-invisible middle of the spectrum — bisexual erasure, emerging identities, and sexual fluidity.

name: Asexual, Aromantic, and Emerging Identities
description: The A in LGBTQIA+ — asexuality, aromanticism, the ace spectrum, and how identity continues to evolve.

name: The Future of LGBTQ+ Rights in America
description: Where things stand now and where they're headed — the current legal landscape, emerging threats, and what comes next.
